entries.content: As soon as someone says no, ask one last question to diagnose if it's a real 'no' or a timing issue/failure in communication before moving on.
Don't argue with prospects who say no. Disqualify them efficiently if the 'no' is genuine.
If a prospect doesn't recognize the symptoms of problems you fix right now, suggest calling back in the future, acknowledging that timing might be off.
entries.notes: Implies diagnosing timing vs. fundamental disinterest.

entries.content: If you don't recognize any of it, I'll call you back in three months, because at some point these symptoms are going to metastasize into a full-blown illness.
entries.notes: Used to diagnose timing and set future expectation.

entries.content: Talk about the symptoms of problems you fix and ask the prospect if they recognize any of them to probe for current need or potential future need.

focus_area: Handling "Not Interested": Probe softly, diagnose if disinterest or timing
